part.narration: Headquarters office. The windows are wide open. The CEO, shirt half-unbuttoned, fans his sweat and shields half of his face while staring at Yuki. Yuki has never had a job interview before. Does this make her important? How do you speak to a CEO? Are you supposed to be assertive? Do they like that? Now shivering, Yuki bows.
part.line: Hello my name is Yuki Soleil-Takeshi and I am programmer would like to work for your company—
part.narration: Yuki clears her throat. Her pupils move upward left:
part.line: I mean, I would like to apply for a position that will best utilize and improve my skills.
part.narration: The CEO returns not the bow. He glares at Yuki.
part.line: No such position, get the hell out of my office.
part.narration: Yuki, discouraged, sniffles. Why did she leave the house? She could have stayed inside and played the chicken-riding game if she knew she was just going to get rejected again. It's better to just assume that no one will ever hire her. The CEO, and his right-hand, Nozomi, burst into laughter.
part.line: Harsh, Prez— that line's better than the one I gave her father.
Huh?
So, what makes this one a good candidate?
Success in befriending this old VP,
and hope that apples fall not far from trees.
part.narration: The CEO had known it all along.
part.line: And so twice I cross paths with good old Jacques.
Mademoiselle, I insist, have a seat.
Yes, sir.
part.narration: The CEO pours two glasses of scotch. He puts one before himself. He puts the other before Yuki.The Main Action turns to, when out of the chair, sit; within the chair, drink. (action scope system under consideration.) In the midst of the player's walk (to demonstrate that dialog boxes do not interrupt gameplay), the CEO asks Yuki some questions, while preparing a drink for her. The order in which the player attends to these three things affects the outcome of later conditions.
part.line: Cats or dogs?

choice.line: I think dogs are good.
Uh-huh.
I like cats very much.
Hmm.

part.line: Coke or Pepsi?

choice.line: Coke feels better.
Hmm.
Pepsi is sweeter.
Uh-huh.

part.line: So what do you think about the adverse effects the subprime mortgage crisis has had on Japan's luxury sectors?

choice.line: I'm poor and that makes me sad.
Okay.
I'm poor but hope for future.
Me too.

part.line: Believe it or not, I elaborately designed this situation to get into the inner workings of your mind.
My analysis:

choice.comment: If the player answered the questions first...
choice.line: You were quicker to talk about yourself than you were to take a seat.
You're selfish. Egocentric.
What we need is a team player!

choice.comment: If the player sat down first...
choice.line: You couldn't wait to sit down, huh? You were getting weak in the knees.
It's understandable, this is no doubt your first interaction with a real leader.
What we need is someone bold!

choice.comment: If the player had a drink first...
choice.line: You place quite the priority on courage water, and it frightens me.
Looking for an escape before you've been trapped, huh?
Implying you think you deserve such entrapment?
As much as I enjoy paradoxical confidence, this company needs pragmatic programmers!

part.line: My deepest apologies, Mademoiselle Soleil.
I feel you are not Sega material, nor will you ever be Sega material—
I quit!
Oh no! What ever do you mean?
I hereby resign my position as Vice President of the Sega Corporation.
Oh me, oh my! Who will ever take your place? Should we nominate the relentlessly realistic Hanako Shimizu?
I object to such a decision!
What be thy reasoning?
Shimizu is an asshole.
part.narration: Another bout of laughter twixt the twain.
part.line: Let's cut to the chase. Yuki, follow me.
part.narration: Yuki, eyes wide open and mouth agape, nods.The Main Action for the chair is to get up. Hopefully, Yuki's senses aren't impaired.

choice.narration: Yuki had the whole glass of alcohol. She trip over chair and break a legs— not her legs but its.
Yuki barely drank. She rises from her seating and folds her hands together.

part.narration: The CEO presses a button. The fluorescents dim. The windowblinds shut. Down comes the sheet. A projector lights the room, yet dark still looms. Projected is a graphic of plummeting financial data over a period of two years.The CEO urges the player to run all the way to the right side of the elongated chart.
part.line: Mademoiselle, the Sega Corporation's market share has reached an all-time low of one percent.
With our position worsened by the recession, we face an inescapable bankruptcy.
part.narration: The CEO urges the Player to have Yuki all the way to the left of the elongated chart and drag The Group's name onto the chart on the projection computer interface.The CEO lays another organization's financial data over Sega's. The organization's name is:
part.line: The Group
part.narration: Shown is an exponential curve from day one that reaches heaven by day five.
The CEO focuses the chart on the last six months. In bold type on Sega's December 12th are the words:
part.line: Game Over
Since The Group is poised to eliminate the Parisian-Nagoyan Network,
they plan to destroy us, too, and become the Only Video Game Company in Japan.
We have no means to resist.
I cannot save us.
Nozomi cannot save us.
You cannot save us.
You will be the next Vice President.
Nobody here has what you have, Yuki. Nobody here has a fresh mind.
This company faces the most foreign of situations. Bankruptcy lies in no corporation's strategy.
You are here to teach us the art of dying. You are our divine wind.
Will you guide us to our grave?
part.narration: Silence. The CEO and Nozomi stare at Yuki. Yuki bursts into laughter.
part.line: I always knew I was destined to fail!
Let's do it.
part.narration: The CEO smiles. He presses a button. The fluorescents beam. The windowblinds open. Up goes the sheet.
part.line: Congratulations. Welcome to Sega.
I told you I'd get you a job! High five!
part.narration: The Player is urged not to leave her hanging.Yuki goes for the high five and gets the embrace. Everyone laughs. All in good spirits? Sudden cut to the hallway.
